Hiragana is the basic Japanese phonetic script. It represents every sound in the Japanese language. \
あ is pronounced like the \"a\" in \"car\"
い is pronounced like the \"ee\" in \"eel\"
う is pronounced like the \"oo\" in \"pool\"
え is pronounced like the \"e\" in \"egg\"
お is pronounced like you\'re saying \"oh\"
か is pronounced like the \"ca\" in \"cat\"
き is pronounced like the \"ke\" in \"key\"
く is pronounced like the \"coo\" in \"cookie\"
け is pronounced like the \"ke\" in \"kettle\"
こ is pronounced like the \"co\" in \"code\"
が is pronounced like the \"ga\" in \"garage\"
ぎ is pronounced like the \"ge\" in \"geek\"
ぐ is pronounced like \"goo\"
げ is pronounced like the \"ge\" in \"gecko\"
ご is pronounced like the \"go\" in \"goat\"
さ is pronounced like the \"sa\" in \"saturday\"
し is pronounced like \"she\"
す is pronounced like \"sue\"
せ is pronounced like the \"se\" in \"set\"
そ is pronounced like the \"so\" in \"soy\"
ざ is pronounced like the \"za\" in \"zap\"
じ is pronounced like \"zhi\"
ず is pronounced like \"zoo\"
ぜ is pronounced like \"zey\"
ぞ is pronounced like \"zoh\"
た is pronounced like the \"ta\" in \"tan\"
ち is pronounced like the \"chi\" in \"chia\"
つ is just the \"Ts\" sound plus う, making a \"tsu\" sound
て is pronounced like the \"te\" in \"tent\"
と is pronounced like \"toe\"
だ is pronounced like the \"da\" in \"day\"
ぢ is pronounced like the \"ji\" in \"gee\"
づ is pronounced like \"dzu\"
で is pronounced like the \"de\" in \"death\"
ど is pronounced like \"doe\"
ま is pronounced like the \"ma\" in \"mama\"
み is pronounced like \"me\"
む is pronounced like \"moo\"
め is pronounced like the \"me\" in \"memo\"
も is pronounced like \"mow\"
な is pronounced like the \"na\" in \"Namaimo\"
に is pronounced like \"knee\"
ぬ is pronounced like \"new\"
ね is pronounced like the \"ne\" in \"net\"
の is pronounced like \"no\"
